title: Set-up OSG to work with ssgrid
text: easiest way follow instructions OSG help portal. Step 1 instructions follow steps Unix-based operating system (Linux/Mac) latest Windows 10 versions. using Windows PowerShell terminal can skip chmod 700 ~/.ssh command. Otherwise follow rest instructions.

what: 2. Setting up the portable R library
title: Set-up OSG to work with ssgrid
text: Similar step 1, OSG help portal contains good help setting portable library. steps needed create R portable library work ssgrid. Step 2.1: login assigned OSG login node. prefer via ssh using terminal choice. case user .username login node 05. Step 2.2: logged , create directory house portable R library. Step 2.3: Enter environment appropriate version R1. Step 2.4: Declare global variables describing R install packages, launch R. Step 2.5: inside R, check see directory created step 2.1, R-packages, library path. Step 2.6: Still within R, install remotes r4ss packages. remotes needed install github version r4ss2. Follow -screen prompts install packages, exit R. Step 2.7: Exit R environment entered step 2.3. Next tar portable R library delete uncompressed directory save space.
code: ssh your.username@login05.osgconnect.net mkdir -p R-lib-4.0.2/R-packages   cd R-lib-4.0.2 singularity shell /cvmfs/singularity.opensciencegrid.org/opensciencegrid/osgvo-r:4.0.2 export R_LIBS=$PWD/R-packages   export TMPDIR=$PWD   R .libPaths() # check to see if 'R-packages' directory is in library path install.packages("remotes", repos = "http://cloud.r-project.org/")   remotes::install_github("r4ss/r4ss",dependencies=TRUE)   q(save="no") exit   touch R-packages.tar.gz   tar -czf R-packages.tar.gz R-packages/   rm -r R-packages

title: Set-up OSG to work with ssgrid
text: OSG help portal contains page describing upload files OSG using scp. approach take. Step 3.1: Download Stock Synthesis linux executable choice. Make sure rename whatever linux version download ss_linux since ssgrid functions look name. Step 3.2: still logged OSG terminal, connect OSG via ssh. make directory upload ss_linux . ssgrid default look directory called ss_executable. directory made, close ssh connection. Step 3.3: Navigate local directory downloaded ss_linux using terminal choice. Next, upload OSG via scp.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nicholas Ducharme-Barth. Author, maintainer. Megumi Oshima. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ducharme-Barth N (2022). ssgrid: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities. https://github.com/N-DucharmeBarth-NOAA/ssgrid, https://n-ducharmebarth-noaa.github.io/ssgrid/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ssgrid: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities},   author = {Nicholas Ducharme-Barth},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/N-DucharmeBarth-NOAA/ssgrid, https://n-ducharmebarth-noaa.github.io/ssgrid/}, }

title: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities
text: Utility functions running Stock Synthesis (SS) models OpenScienceGrid (OSG) HTCondor network. package facilitates running Stock Synthesis models following advanced diagnostics OSG: retrospective R0 likelihood profile age-structured production model (ASPM) deterministic recruitment model ssgrid contains functions : connecting OSG uploading files OSG creating HTcondor condor_submit script creating bash shell script executed condor_submit script creating R scripts needed manipulate SS files using r4ss functions order run advanced diagnostics. submiting HTcondor job downloading completed model runs cleaning directories OSG

title: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities
text: Package active development. Code base may change without warning prior first stable release.

title: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities
text: ssgrid currently supported CRAN. can install development version ssgrid GitHub :

title: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities
text: Please see ssgrid webpage information, along following articles get started: Setting OSG environment work ssgrid

title: ssgrid: Stock Sythesis - OpenScienceGrid - utilities
text: base code: osg_connect() base code: osg_multi_copy() base code: osg_upload_ss_dir() base code: osg_wrapper_create() base code: osg_condor_submit_create() base code: osg_r_script_create() base code: osg_execute() base code: osg_monitor() base code: osg_clean() (option just remove logs) base code: osg_download_ss_dir() (download end.tar.gz, optionally download logs, optionally remove files osg via osg_clean downloading) osg_upload_ss_dir(): create target directory text file add flexibility input/output args osg_wrapper_create(): option suppress log files osg_wrapper_create(): add options running diagnostics (ASPM, retrospectives, R0 profile, jitter) via R scripts osg_r_script_create(): add options user pass R script Documentation (roxygen2) Make package: description, license, git-hub actions, github-pages, NOAA template Add vignettes: setting OSG environment Add vignettes: launching/retrieving job array Add vignettes: running diagnostics across job array Add vignettes: model ensemble example (extracting quantities combining MVLN) Add vignettes: run custom submit script, r script, wrapper script

what: This function cleans directories of given files and sub-directories on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_clean
title: This function cleans directories of given files and sub-directories on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_clean
text: function cleans directories given files sub-directories Open Science Grid (OSG).

title: This function cleans directories of given files and sub-directories on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_clean
code: osg_clean(   session = NULL,   unix_name,   login_node,   rsa_keyfile = NULL,   rsa_passphrase = NULL,   remote_dirs,   clean_files = NULL,   clean_subdirs = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: This function cleans directories of given files and sub-directories on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_clean
text: session ssh connection created osg_connect. unix_name Character string giving OSG unix login name. login_node Character string giving OSG login node (e.g., login05.osgconnect.net). rsa_keyfile Path private key file. Must OpenSSH format (see details). Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. rsa_passphrase Either string callback function password prompt. Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. remote_dirs Character vector giving path directories clean OSG login node. clean_files Character vector giving files remove remote_dirs. Defaults files except End.tar.gz. clean_subdirs Character vector giving path directories delete OSG login node. verbose Boolean denoting function details printed.

title: This function cleans directories of given files and sub-directories on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_clean
text: Returns 0 exit.

what: This function writes a condor_submit script to be executed on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_condor_submit_create
title: This function writes a condor_submit script to be executed on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_condor_submit_create
text: function saves copy locally, uploads copy osg, modifies permissions can executed remotely

title: This function writes a condor_submit script to be executed on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_condor_submit_create
code: osg_condor_submit_create(   session = NULL,   unix_name,   login_node,   rsa_keyfile = NULL,   rsa_passphrase = NULL,   local_shell_path = NULL,   remote_shell_path = "scripts/condor_submit/",   file_name = "condor.sub",   c_executable = "scripts/bash/wrapper.sh",   c_input_files = c("Start.tar.gz"),   c_output_files = c("End.tar.gz"),   c_project = NULL,   c_memory = "2GB",   c_disk = "2GB",   c_target_dir_path = NULL,   c_singularity = NULL,   overwrite = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: This function writes a condor_submit script to be executed on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_condor_submit_create
text: session ssh connection created osg_connect. unix_name Character string giving OSG unix login name. login_node Character string giving OSG login node (e.g., login05.osgconnect.net). rsa_keyfile Path private key file. Must OpenSSH format (see details). Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. rsa_passphrase Either string callback function password prompt. Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. local_shell_path Path directory condor_submit script written. Defaults tempdir. remote_shell_path Path directory OSG login node condor_submit script written. file_name Name given condor_submit script. c_executable Name executable bash script executed condor_submit script. c_input_files Character vector input files passed condor job. c_output_files Character vector output files returned condor job. c_project OSG project submit job . c_memory Requested RAM condor job (e.g., 200MB 2GB) c_disk Requested disk storage condor job (e.g., 200MB 2GB) c_target_dir_path Path OSG login node text file giving directory execute condor job . c_singularity Character string specifiying R version use. Defaults NULL. r:3.5.0 R version 3.5.0 r:4.0.2 R version 4.0.2 overwrite file given file_name exists local_shell_path remote_shell_path overwrite TRUE. verbose Boolean denoting function details printed.

title: This function writes a condor_submit script to be executed on the Open Science Grid (OSG). — osg_condor_submit_create
text: Returns 0 exit.

See ssh_connect details. remote_dir_stem Path OSG login node directory download. remote_dirs Character vector sub-directories download remote_dir_stem. download_dir_stem Path directory local machin download . files_to_download Files download directory given remote_dirs. untar_local Boolean denoting whether untar downloaded *tar.gz files. clean_remote Boolean denoting whether clean remote_dirs using osg_clean. delete_remote Boolean denoting whether delete remote_dirs. verbose Boolean denoting function details printed.

what: This function writes an R script which can be executed within the wrapper.sh to set-up and run diagnostics using existing r4ss code. — osg_r_create

text: function saves copy locally, uploads copy Open Science Grid (OSG), modifies permissions can executed remotely

title: This function writes an R script which can be executed within the wrapper.sh to set-up and run diagnostics using existing r4ss code. — osg_r_create
code: osg_r_create(   session = NULL,   unix_name,   login_node,   rsa_keyfile = NULL,   rsa_passphrase = NULL,   local_shell_path = NULL,   remote_shell_path = "scripts/r/",   diagnostic_type = NULL,   overwrite = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   retro_n_years = NULL,   r0_maxdiff = NULL,   r0_step = NULL )

title: This function writes an R script which can be executed within the wrapper.sh to set-up and run diagnostics using existing r4ss code. — osg_r_create
text: session ssh connection created osg_connect. unix_name Character string giving OSG unix login name. login_node Character string giving OSG login node (e.g., login05.osgconnect.net). rsa_keyfile Path private key file. Must OpenSSH format (see details). Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. rsa_passphrase Either string callback function password prompt. Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. local_shell_path Path directory condor_submit script written. Defaults tempdir. remote_shell_path Path directory OSG login node condor_submit script written. diagnostic_type character string specifying diagnostic run. "01_run_retro" Conduct retrospective analysis length retro_n_years. "02_run_R0profile" Conduct likelihood profile R0 profile extends +/- r0_maxdiff log(R0) maximum likelihood estimate interval specified r0_step. "03_run_aspm" Conduct age structured production (ASPM) deterministic recruitment runs model. Warning: ASPM hard coded settings may appropriate model. overwrite file given file_name exists local_shell_path remote_shell_path overwrite TRUE. verbose Boolean denoting function details printed. retro_n_years number years retrospective analysis. r0_maxdiff maximum distance log(R0) maximum likelihood estimate profile extend. r0_step step size used profiling (log scale).

title: This function writes an R script which can be executed within the wrapper.sh to set-up and run diagnostics using existing r4ss code. — osg_r_create
text: Returns 0 exit.

See ssh_connect details. local_dir_path Path directory local machine upload OSG. local_dir_names Character vector sub-directories within local_dir_path upload OSG. remote_dir_path Path OSG login node upload local_dir_names . files_to_upload Character vector giving file names upload OSG. target_dir_path Path OSG login node text file giving directory execute condor jobs . target_dir_txt_name File name given text file containing path directory execute condor jobs . verbose Boolean denoting function details printed.

title: This function writes a bash shell wrapper script to be executed within each specified directory — osg_wrapper_create
text: session ssh connection created osg_connect. unix_name Character string giving OSG unix login name. login_node Character string giving OSG login node (e.g., login05.osgconnect.net). rsa_keyfile Path private key file. Must OpenSSH format (see details). Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. rsa_passphrase Either string callback function password prompt. Default NULL. See ssh_connect details. local_shell_path Path directory condor_submit script written. Defaults tempdir. remote_shell_path Path directory OSG login node condor_submit script written. file_name Character string giving name executable, defaults "wrapper.sh". wrapper_actions character vector specifying 4 possible actions can executed. Multiple actions possible must one : #' "00_run_ss"  "01_run_retro"  "02_run_R0profile"  "03_run_aspm"  overwrite file given file_name exists local_shell_path remote_shell_path overwrite TRUE. verbose Boolean denoting function details printed.
